The UOM that defines the number of units that are able to be produced on this Production Policy. This can be any UOM of Type = Quantity, Weight, Volume. If there are Processes defined, the information in the Processes table will override any information that exists in the Production Policies table

The UOM that defines the amount of time that the Production Rate is expressed in. This can be any UOM of Type = Time. If there are Processes defined, the information in the Processes table will override any information that exists in the Production Policies table

The Work Center assigned to the Production Policy; the production time and capacity consumed by the production at the listed Facility / Product will count toward the capacity of the Work Center. If a Process is also specified for this Production Policy, then this Work Center field is ignored and the value from the Processes table will take precedence.

WorkCenter groups are not supported.

The Bill of Material record that will be associated with any productions that occur at the Facility/Product combination. If a BOM is specified, in order to produce the product for this policy record the production location must also be able to source all required components as entered in the BOM

BOM Groups are not currently supported.

The Process associated with the production behavior for the specified Facility/Product combination. Processes offer a more detailed step by step production behavior that can specify the work time per unit, which Work Centers or Work Resources must be used, and at which points a component is required in the production flow.

Process Groups are not currently supported.
For SIM Policy = Continuous Production, the SIM Policy Lot Size will determine the size of each production order that is triggered for the Facility / Product combination.
The UOM that specifies what unit the SIM Policy Lot Size will be defined in. This can be any UOM of Type = Quantity, Weight, Volume.
The rate of CO2 emissions for this production policy.
The unit of measure (Type = Quantity, Volume, Weight, Time) that defines the CO2 Emission Rate.
ProductionPolicies.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE UnitsOfMeasure.Type = [Quantity, Volume, Weight, Time]

ProductionPoliciesMultiTimePeriod.Explanation: The period name in which a change is being made. Groups of periods are also supported. Changes that are made in the Multi Time Period table will be applied as overrides for the records of the base table for the specified periods only. Additionally, only the fields that contain information needing to be updated are required to be entered, in the absence of data in the Multi Time Period table the data from the standard table will be persisted
The Facility at which the production policy is being defined
The Product for which the production policy is being defined
Status dictates whether or not the multi-time period record exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the record is ignored during the model run.

Policy Status dictates whether or not the policy exists in the model for the specified period(s). If Policy Status is set to Exclude, the policy record is ignored during the model run for the specified periods.

The policy that will dictate the production logic for the Facility/Product combination. Make By Demand will trigger production events based on the Production Orders which are triggered by the Inventory Policy for the Facility/Product combination. Make By Schedule will trigger production events based off of Production Orders specified in the Production Orders / Recurring Production Orders tables. Make By Demand And Schedule will trigger production orders based on both the Inventory Policy and the orders specified in the Production Orders / Recurring Production Orders tables. Continuous Production will continuously trigger production orders of the amount specified in the SIM Policy Lot Size field as soon as the production of the previous lot is completed.
ProductionPoliciesMultiTimePeriod.Data Type: [Make By Demand, Make By Schedule, Make By Demand And Schedule, Continuous Production]

ProductionPoliciesMultiTimePeriod.Explanation: The unit cost of a production flow at the Facility/Product combination. This field can support either a single numeric value, a lookup into a defined step cost, or a custom cost function entered directly into the field. If there are Processes defined, the information in the Processes table will override any information that exists in the Production Policies table
ProductionPoliciesMultiTimePeriod.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE StepCosts.StepCostBehavior = [All Item, Incremental, Stepwise]

ProductionPoliciesMultiTimePeriod.Explanation: The UOM that specifies what unit the Unit Cost will be applied over. This can be any UOM of Type = Quantity, Weight, Volume. If there are Processes defined, the information in the Processes table will override any information that exists in the Production Policies table

The production rate for the given Facility/Product combination. It will be defined as Quantity/Time as is specified in the Quantity/Time UOM fields. If there are Processes defined, the information in the Processes table will override any information that exists in the Production Policies table

The UOM that defines the number of units that are able to be produced on this Production Policy. This can be any UOM of Type = Quantity, Weight, Volume. If there are Processes defined, the information in the Processes table will override any information that exists in the Production Policies table

The UOM that defines the amount of time that the Production Rate is expressed in. This can be any UOM of Type = Time. If there are Processes defined, the information in the Processes table will override any information that exists in the Production Policies table

The Work Center assigned to the Production Policy; the production time and capacity consumed by the production at the listed Facility / Product will count toward the capacity of the Work Center. If a Process is also specified for this Production Policy, then this Work Center field is ignored and the value from the Processes table will take precedence.

WorkCenter groups are not supported

The Bill of Material record that will be associated with any productions that occur at the Facility/Product combination. If a BOM is specified, in order to produce the product for this policy record the production location must also be able to source all required components as entered in the BOM

BOM Groups are not currently supported.

The Process associated with the production behavior for the specified Facility/Product combination. Processes offer a more detailed step by step production behavior that can specify the work time per unit, which Work Centers or Work Resources must be used, and at which points a component is required in the production flow.

Process Groups are not currently supported.
For SIM Policy = Continuous Production, the SIM Policy Lot Size will determine the size of each production order that is triggered for the Facility / Product combination.
The UOM that specifies what unit the SIM Policy Lot Size will be defined in. This can be any UOM of Type = Quantity, Weight, Volume.
The rate of CO2 emissions for this production policy for the given period.
The unit of measure (Type = Quantity, Volume, Weight, Time) that defines the CO2 Emission Rate.
ProductionPoliciesMultiTimePeriod.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE UnitsOfMeasure.Type = [Quantity, Volume, Weight, Time]

ProductionQueueDetails.Explanation: The facility that the queue logic is applied for

The first Date/Time at which to review the queue for the specified production queue. Production queues will be evaluated using the logic specified in the Priority Logic field. After this Date/Time, the review period length will dictate when production queue reviews occur. If NULL, Review Period First Time will be the start of the simulation.

The time between production queue reviews. After Review Period First Time, a production queue review will occur each time Review Period has elapsed. For example, if Review Period First Time is 1/1/2022 12:00:00 AM and Review Period is six hours, we will conduct reviews on 1/1/2022 at 12:00:00 AM, 6:00:00 AM, 12:00:00 PM, and 6:00:00 PM, continuing similarly until the simulation ends. A Review Schedule defined in the Review Schedules table can be entered by Review Schedule Name in this field as well. If NULL, continuous review is used.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Review Period length.

The logic used for the production queue when deciding how to arrange orders in the production queue. If a value of By Date And Location is selected, the QueuePriority fields in the Customers, Facilities, and Suppliers will be leveraged. If the Advanced Queueing Details table is populated, the override priorities for the Origin, Destination, Product combination will be used
The value associated with the given queueing priority logic.  For ProductionWheel this will contain the name of the wheel
Status dictates whether or not the policy exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the policy record is ignored during the model run.

The cost associated with an item sitting in a queue. The cost expressed in this field will be charged each time that items sit in a queue for the length of time specified in the Time In Queue Cost UOM field.
The unit of measure that time is expressed in terms of.

ProductionWheelDetails.Explanation: The name of the production wheel
The Product for which the entry in the production wheel is being defined
Status dictates whether or not the row of the Production Wheel is passed into the engine. If Status is set to Exclude, this record will be ignored during the model run.
The position in the wheel for the given product

The duration of the production wheel element. If the duration is hit while in the middle of processing an order, that order will complete. If the duration is not met and all orders are finished processing, the logic used in the Duration Policy will determine the production activity.
The unit of measurement for the duration.
The policy to be used when the existing orders will not fill the entire duration.
Minimum value to be produced for the defined production wheel slot
Maximum value to be produced for the defined production wheel slot
The UOM that defines the Min / Max Production Quantities. Quantity, Volume and Weight UOM entries are supported.
The policy to be used when the existing collection of orders for the product does not meet the Min Production Quantity.

Products.Explanation: Status dictates whether or not the Product exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, any records for the Product in other tables will be ignored.
The value of the Product; this field will be used to calculate inventory holding costs.
The unit of measure that defines the basis for Unit Value. For example, we could set the Product's Unit Value as $5 per pound or $5 each.
Unit Price represents the price that the Product will sell for; in other words, this value is the revenue that will be generated by satisfying one unit of demand for the Product.
The unit of measure that defines the basis for Unit Price. For example, we could specify that the Unit Price applies to one case or one pound of the Product.
The unit of measure (Type = Volume) used to define the Product's volume.
The unit of measure (Type = Weight) used to define Unit Weight.
The unit of measure (Type = Length) used to define the Product's dimensions.

The Shelf Life will determine the length of time that a product will be valid before it expires. When being used in Optimization, Shelf Life will be evaluated against the period lengths to determine which period a product will expire in. For example, if the Shelf Life is 45 Days and a model has monthly periods, the product will expire in Period 2.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines the length of the Product's Shelf Life

ProductsMultiTimePeriod.Explanation: The period name in which a change is being made. Groups of periods are also supported. Changes that are made in the Multi Time Period table will be applied as overrides for the records of the base table for the specified periods only. Additionally, only the fields that contain information needing to be updated are required to be entered, in the absence of data in the Multi Time Period table the data from the standard table will be persisted
Status dictates whether or not the multi-time period record exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the record is ignored during the model run.
The value of the Product; this field will be used to calculate inventory holding costs.
The unit of measure that defines the basis for Unit Value. For example, we could set the Product's Unit Value as $5 per pound or $5 each.
Unit Price represents the price that the Product will sell for; in other words, this value is the revenue that will be generated by satisfying one unit of demand for the Product.
The unit of measure that defines the basis for Unit Price. For example, we could specify that the Unit Price applies to one case or one pound of the Product.

RelationshipConstraints.Explanation: The first entity that exists in the relationship. Entity 1 and Entity 2 will be prevented from moving together during the Hopper solve. Groups are supported.
The type of object that Entity 1 is, one of Transportation Asset, Product, Shipment or Customer.
The second entity that exists in the relationship. Entity 1 and Entity 2 will prevented from moving together during the Hopper solve. Groups are supported.
The type of object that Entity 2 is, one of Transportation Asset, Product, Shipment or Customer.
Status dictates whether or not the Line Item exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, this record will be ignored during the model run.

ReplenishmentOrderProfiles.Explanation: The unique identifier for each Order profile, as orders are generated based on their recurring properties they will be indexed off of the entered order number. All Orders will be placed as single line item orders, however multiple recurring orders can be set at the same Facility
The name of the Facility placing the Order
The Product that the Order will be placed for
Status dictates whether or not the Order profile exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, this  record will be ignored during the model run.
The amount of Product being ordered by the Facility. Both doubles, as well as distributions are accepted as entries.
The unit of measure that defines Quantity. Quantity, Volume, and Weight units of measure are supported.

Based on the information entered in the Start Date, Time Between Orders and End Date fields, the Order Profile will generate orders based at different times throughout the simulation. When an order is generated, the Number Of Orders will be evaluated to determine how many orders are going to be placed at that specific time. Once the Number Of Orders is determined, all of the other information specified in the Product Name, Quantity, Number of Lines will be used to generate the details for each of the orders at that time.

If the Product Name is left blank for the Order Profile, recurring orders can be generated with a varying number of line items in each order. An integer value, or a distribution can be entered in this field. In the event that the number of lines in an order is 2 or greater, the Order Profile Product Selection and Order Profile Product Affinity tables will be used to determine which products are to be ordered.
Service Level will be used to calculate the Due Date for all of the generated recurring orders. Due Date will be set to the Order Date + Service Level.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) used to define Service Level.

The Start Date will defined the date that the first order will drop. Orders will drop exactly at the date/time specified in Start Date, and then each following order's drop date will be determined by the Time Between Orders information.
Time Between Orders will specify how much time goes by from the previous order until the next order drops. Both doubles, as well as distribution entries are supported.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) used to define Time Between Orders.

The End Date will specify the last possible time that an order can drop. If the Time Between Orders causes the next order drop date to fall after the specified End Date, that last order will not be generated.

ReplenishmentOrders.Explanation: The unique identifier for each Order; an Order consists of one or more Line Items.
The unique identifier for the single Line Item being defined; Orders with multiple Line Items will require multiple table records.
The name of the Facility placing the Order. Facility Groups are supported; the Group behavior will be Enumerate.
The Product in the Line Item.
The amount of Product requested by the Facility.
The unit of measure that defines Quantity. Quantity, Volume, and Weight units of measure are supported.
The date and time at which the Facility places the Order.
The date and time at which the Order is due at the Facility.
Status dictates whether or not the Line Item exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, this  record will be ignored during the model run.

Optionally, a required Transportation Mode can be specified here. If multiple Modes are acceptable, a Mode Group may be used; the Group behavior will be Aggregate. If NULL, any Mode is assumed to be acceptable.

Optionally, a required Source for the Line Item can be specified here. If multiple Sources are acceptable, a Source (Facility or Supplier) Group may be used; the Group behavior will be Aggregate. If NULL, any Source is assumed to be acceptable.

If True, all Line Items in the Order must be sourced from a single Facility. If False, each Line Item within the Order may be sourced from a different Facility. A value of True in this field overrides Single Source Line Items = False, enforcing that all Line Items in the order come from a single source.
If True, the entire Line Item must be sourced from a single site (Facility or Supplier). If False, the Line Item may be sourced from different sites.

If True, the Order may be partially filled. Otherwise, it must be filled in full. If backordering is allowed, the remaining quantity may be satisfied in the future with additional shipments; if the Backorder Time Limit is reached on a partially filled order, the remaining quantity will be cancelled. If Partial Fill Orders is False, Partial Fill Line Items will also be forced to False.

If True, the specified Line Item may be partially filled. Otherwise, the Line Item must be filled in full. If backordering is allowed, the remaining quantity of partially filled Line Items may be satisfied in the future with additional shipments; if the Backorder Time Limit is reached on a partially filled Line Item, the remaining quantity will be cancelled.

If True, the Facility will accept a backorder in the event that the Order cannot be fulfilled before its Due Date. If False and if the Order is not fulfilled by its Due Date, it will be cancelled on that date.

If Allow Backorders = True, this value is the amount of time after which the backorder will be cancelled by the Facility. A value of NULL will be interpreted as an infinite time limit, while a value of zero is equivalent to setting Allow Backorders = False.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) used to define Backorder Time Limit.

ReplenishmentPolicies.Explanation: The Facility that the policy record applies to. If Procurement Policies are also defined for the Facility, Replenishment Policies will take priority.
The Product that the policy record applies to.
The Facility from which the Product will be sourced under the policy record.

The logic that replenishment flows for the Facility, Product, and Source combination(s) must follow. To Optimize selects the lowest cost option. By Ratio (Auto Scale) will enforce a flow split between the specified sources, the defined ratios will apply to flow into the Facility from the listed sources only. By Ratio (No Scale) will enforce a flow split between the specified sources and the defined ratios will be in terms of the total inbound flow into the Facility. Single Source policies force the Facility to receive the Product from one Source. Note that if a group is used in the Facility Name, Product Name, or Source Name field that the groups will be enumerated and the policy logic will be applied over the enumerated entries.
ReplenishmentPolicies.Data Type: [To Optimize, By Ratio (Auto Scale), By Ratio (No Scale), Single Source]

ReplenishmentPolicies.RequiredIf: OptimizationPolicy = By Ratio (Auto Scale) OR By Ratio (No Scale)
ReplenishmentPolicies.Explanation:
By Ratio (Auto Scale): The Policy Value will define the percentage of flow that must be satisfied from the listed source. The percentage will be calculated based on the total inbound flow for the Facility/Product combination from sources with a policy of By Ratio (Auto Scale).

By Ratio (No Scale): The Policy Value will define the percentage of flow that must be satisfied from the listed source. The percentage will be calculated based on the total inbound flow for the Facility/Product combination across ALL sources.

The logic that replenishment flows for the Facility, Product, and Source combination(s) must follow. By Preference will pick the sources pending product availability in the specified order of preference. Single Source policies force the Facility to receive the Product from one Source.
By Preference: Policy Value defines the order of preference in which a source will be selected pending product availability, with the lower numbers representing a higher selection preference

Simulation Policy Logic will specify whether the sourcing behavior specified for the Replenishment Policy is a Pull action (Facility selecting a Source) or a Push action (Source selecting a Facility to send surplus inventory). Surplus Level definitions, and a Surplus Review Period will be set in the Inventory Policies table.
Status dictates whether or not the policy exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the policy record is ignored during the model run.

The unit cost associated with flow for the specified Source/Facility/Product combination. This field can support a single numeric value, a step cost (either a direct entry or a lookup), or a custom cost function.
ReplenishmentPolicies.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE StepCosts.StepCostBehavior = [All Item, Incremental, Stepwise]

ReplenishmentPolicies.Explanation: The unit of measure used to define flow for the specified Source/Facility/Product combination.
The minimum quantity that must move between source and destination in a period for a flow to occur
The unit of measure that defines the MOQ for the Source/Facility/Product combination.
Orders placed from the Facility to the specified sources must be filled in multiples of the specified lot size.
The unit of measure that defines the Lot Size for the Source/Facility/Product combination.

The maximum allowable distance between Customer and Source for the Product(s) specified. This field is intended for use in models with group policies to eliminate excessively long lanes from consideration.
The unit of measure (Type = Distance) that defines Max Delivery Range.
If True, when selecting a source for the Facility / Product combination only sources that have available surplus can be selected to fulfill the order.

ReplenishmentPoliciesMultiTimePeriod.Explanation: The period name in which a change is being made. Groups of periods are also supported. Changes that are made in the Multi Time Period table will be applied as overrides for the records of the base table for the specified periods only. Additionally, only the fields that contain information needing to be updated are required to be entered, in the absence of data in the Multi Time Period table the data from the standard table will be persisted
The Facility that the policy record applies to. If Procurement Policies are also defined for the Facility, Replenishment Policies will take priority.
The Product that the policy record applies to.
The Facility from which the Product will be sourced under the policy record.
Status dictates whether or not the multi-time period record exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the record is ignored during the model run.

Policy Status dictates whether or not the policy exists in the model for the specified period(s). If Policy Status is set to Exclude, the policy record is ignored during the model run for the specified periods.

The logic that replenishment flows for the Facility, Product, and Source combination(s) must follow. To Optimize selects the lowest cost option. By Ratio (Auto Scale) will enforce a flow split between the specified sources, the defined ratios will apply to flow into the Facility from the listed sources only. By Ratio (No Scale) will enforce a flow split between the specified sources and the defined ratios will be in terms of the total inbound flow into the Facility. Single Source policies force the Facility to receive the Product from one Source. Note that if a group is used in the Period Name, Facility Name, Product Name, or Source Name field that the groups will be enumerated and the policy logic will be applied over the enumerated entries.
ReplenishmentPoliciesMultiTimePeriod.Data Type: [To Optimize, By Ratio (Auto Scale), By Ratio (No Scale), Single Source]

ReplenishmentPoliciesMultiTimePeriod.RequiredIf: OptimizationPolicy = By Ratio (Auto Scale) OR By Ratio (No Scale)
ReplenishmentPoliciesMultiTimePeriod.Explanation:
By Ratio (Auto Scale): The Policy Value will define the percentage of flow that must be satisfied from the listed source. The percentage will be calculated based on the total inbound flow for the Facility/Product combination from sources with a policy of By Ratio (Auto Scale).

By Ratio (No Scale): The Policy Value will define the percentage of flow that must be satisfied from the listed source. The percentage will be calculated based on the total inbound flow for the Facility/Product combination across ALL sources.

The logic that replenishment flows for the Facility, Product, and Source combination(s) must follow. By Preference will pick the sources pending product availability in the specified order of preference. Single Source policies force the Facility to receive the Product from one Source.
By Preference: Policy Value defines the order of preference in which a source will be selected pending product availability, with the lower numbers representing a higher selection preference

Simulation Policy Logic will specify whether the sourcing behavior specified for the Replenishment Policy is a Pull action (Facility selecting a Source) or a Push action (Source selecting a Facility to send surplus inventory). Surplus Level definitions, and a Surplus Review Period will be set in the Inventory Policies table.

The unit cost associated with flow for the specified Source/Facility/Product combination. This field can support a single numeric value, a step cost (either a direct entry or a lookup), or a custom cost function.
ReplenishmentPoliciesMultiTimePeriod.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE StepCosts.StepCostBehavior = [All Item, Incremental, Stepwise]

ReplenishmentPoliciesMultiTimePeriod.Explanation: The unit of measure used to define flow for the specified Source/Facility/Product combination.
The minimum quantity that must move between source and destination in a period for a flow to occur
The unit of measure that defines the MOQ for the Source/Facility/Product combination.
Orders placed from the Facility to the specified sources must be filled in multiples of the specified lot size.
The unit of measure that defines the Lot Size for the Source/Facility/Product combination.

The maximum allowable distance between Customer and Source for the Product(s) specified. This field is intended for use in models with group policies to eliminate excessively long lanes from consideration.
The unit of measure (Type = Distance) that defines Max Delivery Range.
If True, when selecting a source for the Facility / Product combination only sources that have available surplus can be selected to fulfill the order.

ReviewSchedules.Explanation: The name of the schedule defining review times each day of the week; this value can be referenced in tables dealing with review periods.
The time on Sunday that the review occurs.
The time on Monday that the review occurs.
The time on Tuesday that the review occurs.
The time on Wednesday that the review occurs.
The time on Thursday that the review occurs.
The time on Friday that the review occurs.
The time on Saturday that the review occurs.

RiskBandDefinitions.Explanation: The name of the Risk Band. Risk Bands are referenced by name in all of the Risk Configuration tables. Bands are defined based on a series of levels and associated Risk Scores and when the DART engine is run the corresponding scores will be assigned to all places where the Risk Band is called in the configuration tables.
The lower bound of the step that the Risk Score will be applied over.
The Risk Score that will be selected based on the corresponding band's lower value.

RiskRatingConfigurations.Explanation: The name of the Risk Rating, Risk Ratings will be a combination of a Risk Profile Name, External Data Source Name, and an External Data Date. Risk Ratings that are included will be run, and a default Opti Risk rating will always be run as well.
The name of the Risk Profile. Risk Profiles have weights and bands assigned for all of the various risk components in each of the risk configuration tables.
Status dictates whether or not the Risk Rating will be run in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the Risk Rating is ignored during the model run.

RiskSummaryConfigurations.Explanation: The name of the Risk Profile that the risk configuration is saved for. Risk Profiles are configured to run using specified source data in the Risk Rating Configurations table, and will take the risk weightings and bands associated with the Risk Profile from each of the configuration tables
The weight applied to the Customer Risk when calculating the overall Risk Score.
The weight applied to the Facility Risk when calculating the overall Risk Score.
The weight applied to the Supplier Risk when calculating the overall Risk Score.
The weight applied to the Network Risk when calculating the overall Risk Score.

ScenarioItemAssignments.Explanation: The name of the Scenario to assign Scenario Items to; this value should be defined in the Scenarios table.
The name of a Scenario Item or Rule to apply to this Scenario.
Denotes whether or not the Item is treated as a standard scenario item or a scenario rule.

ScenarioItems.Explanation: The name of the Scenario Item; Scenario Items are assigned to Scenarios via the Scenario Item Assignment table.
Status dictates whether or not the Scenario Item should be included when running any Scenario it is assigned to.

ScenarioRules.Explanation: The name of the Scenario Rule; Scenario Rules are assigned to Scenarios via the Scenario Item Assignments table.
The name of the Scenario Item.
The order in which the item will execute within this scenario rule.

Scenarios.Explanation: The name of the Scenario; this value is unique to a particular collection of Scenario Items (constructed in the Scenario Items table, assigned to a Scenario in the Scenario Item Assignment table). Scenarios allow a user to easily make changes to core model data and obtain corresponding outputs.
Status dictates whether or not the Scenario should be included when selecting model Scenarios to run.

SequentialObjectives.Explanation: The objective that optimization will solve for. Objectives will correspond to the cost and revenue columns from the Optimization Network Summary table, but specific User Defined Variables and User Defined Costs will also be supported. If the Objective Type = UserDefinedVariable or UserDefinedCost, the specific variable or cost can be specified in the UserDefinedObjectiveName column. Sequential Solves will solve for the objectives marked as Priority = 1 first and use this solution as a base for any subsequent solves for lower Priority values. The solution from Priority 1 can then be relaxed within the specified tolerance for each listed Priority 1 objective to find a solution targeting the Priority 2 objectives. This process will be repeated until the lowest priority objective has been solved for.
SequentialObjectives.Data Type: [TotalSupplyChainCost, TotalRevenue, TotalProfit, TotalTransportationCost, TotalShipmentCost, TotalInTransitHoldingCost, TotalDutyCost, TotalProductionCost, TotalPrebuildHoldingCost, TotalTurnEstimatedHoldingCost, TotalStorageCost, TotalSourcingCost, TotalFixedOperatingCost, TotalFixedStartupCost, TotalFixedClosingCost, TotalInboundHandlingCost, TotalOutboundHandlingCost, TotalProcessCost, TotalCO2Cost, TotalCO2Emissions, TotalFuelSurchargeCost, TotalUnservedDemandPenaltyCost, TotalUserDefinedCost, UserDefinedCost, UserDefinedVariable, UserDefinedConstraint, TotalWeightedFlowDistance, TotalWeightedFlowTime, GeographicRisk, ConcentrationRisk, SourceCountRisk, TransportTimeRisk, ScenarioArcsDeviation-CustomerFulfillment, ScenarioArcsDeviation-Procurement, ScenarioArcsDeviation, FlowConstraintsDeviation, ProductionConstraintsDeviation, InventoryConstraintsDeviation, FacilityThroughputCapacityDeviation, WorkCenterThroughputCapacityDeviation, TotalFacilityThroughputQuantity, TotalFacilityThroughputVolume, TotalFacilityThroughputWeight, TotalWorkCenterThroughputQuantity, TotalWorkCenterThroughputVolume, TotalWorkCenterThroughputWeight, TotalWorkCenterThroughputTime]

SequentialObjectives.RequiredIf: ObjectiveType = UserDefinedCost OR UserDefinedVariable OR UserDefinedConstraint OR ScenarioArcsDeviation OR ScenarioArcsDeviation-CustomerFulfillment OR ScenarioArcsDeviation-Procurement
SequentialObjectives.Explanation: If the Objective Type is set as User Defined Variable, User Defined Cost or User Defined Constraint, the specific User Defined Cost, Variable or Constraint can be referenced here. If nothing is specified, All Costs/Variables/Constraints will be considered. If the Objective Type is set as any of the Scenario Arc deviation options, enter the Scenario Name from which flow deviations are being measured.
The numeric value indicating the Objective priority.

The Tolerance value of each objective will specify how much that Objective can be relaxed to solve for the Objective(s) in the next Priority. A value of 10 would mean that the solution could be relaxed by 10 percent.
Status will dictate whether or not the Objective will be considered for the Sequential Solve.

Shipments.Explanation: A unique identifier for the Shipment; a Shipment consists of one or more Line Items.
A unique identifier for the Line Item being defined; Shipments with multiple Line Items will require multiple table records.
The Facility or Supplier that the shipment originates from.
The Facility or Customer that the shipment will be delivered to.
The Product in the Line Item.
The amount of the Product being shipped.
The unit of measure that defines Quantity. Quantity, Volume, and Weight units of measure are supported.
The date and time at which the Shipment is requested.
The date and time at which the Shipment must be delivered.
The date and time of the earliest possible shipment pickup.
The date and time of the latest possible shipment pickup.
The date and time of the earliest possible shipment pickup.
The date and time of the latest possible shipment pickup.
Status dictates whether or not the Line Item exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, this record will be ignored during the model run.

Optionally, a required Transportation Mode can be specified here. If multiple Modes are acceptable, a Mode Group may be used; the Group behavior will be Aggregate. If NULL, any Mode is assumed to be acceptable.

If True, the specified Line Item may be partially filled. Otherwise, the Line Item must be filled in full. The remaining quantity of partially filled Line Items may be satisfied in the future with additional shipments. If Partial Fill Shipment is False, Partial Fill Line Items will also be forced to False.

If True, individual Line Items can be partially filled. If Allow Partial Fill Shipment = False and Allow Partial Fill Line Item = True, the Line Item Partial Fill behavior will override the Shipment Partial Fill behavior.
The fixed time required at the pickup location of the shipment. This will be additive to the FixedPickupTime specified in the Transportation Assets table.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Fixed Pickup Time.
The fixed time required at the delivery location of the shipment. This will be additive to the FixedDeliveryTime specified in the Transportation Assets table.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Fixed Delivery Time.
The time required per unit to be loaded onto an Asset at the pickup location. This will be additive to any UnitPickupTime that is specified in the Transportation Assets table.
The unit of measure that defines the basis on which UnitPickupTime and UnitDeliveryTime will be applied for the Shipment. Quantity, Volume, and Weight units of measure are supported.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Unit Pickup Time.
The time required per unit to be delivered at the destination location. This will be additive to any UnitDeliveryTime that is specified in the Transportation Assets table.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Unit Delivery Time.
The cost to send the shipment directly to the destination.
Shipments.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE StepCosts.StepCostBehavior = [All Item, Incremental, Stepwise]

Shipments.Explanation: If the Shipment is assigned to a Template Route, the Template Route Name is specified here.
The Stop sequence of the shipment on the defined Template Route.
Shipments with the same Decomposition Name will be run together as a subproblem in the Hopper solve.

StepCosts.Explanation: The name given to the Step Cost. This name may be called in other input tables where Step Cost lookups can be used.

The behavior of the Step Cost. Most fields support All Item, Incremental and Stepwise as well as the combination of Stepwise and All Item. The only exceptions are: Fixed Startup, Fixed Operating, and Fixed Closing Costs fields will only support a Step Cost Behavior of Stepwise; the corresponding Cost value will be returned as a one-time cost. Incremental behavior will apply Costs to throughput levels individually. All Item behavior will apply the relevant Cost to the total throughput.

The minimum throughput level at which the relevant Cost is to be applied. All step cost definitions should start with a throughput level of zero; otherwise, the lowest throughput interval will be extended to start at zero.
The unit of measure that defines Throughput Level. Quantity, Volume, Weight and Time units of measure are supported.
StepCosts.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE UnitsOfMeasure.Type = [Quantity, Volume, Weight, Time]

StepCosts.Explanation: The cost value to incur for the specified Throughput Level.
Status dictates whether or not the table record exists. If Status is set to Exclude, this record will not be considered when constructing Step Costs.

SupplierCapabilities.Explanation: The Supplier at which the listed product will be available at
The Product that will be available at the listed Supplier
Status dictates whether or not the policy exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the policy record is ignored during the model run.
The unit cost of the listed Supplier creating the Product. This field can support either a single numeric value or a defined step cost
SupplierCapabilities.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE StepCosts.StepCostBehavior = [All Item, Incremental, Stepwise]

SupplierCapabilities.Explanation: The UOM that specifies what unit the Unit Cost will be applied over. This can be any UOM of Type = Quantity, Weight, Volume.
The maximum amount for the listed product, across all destinations, that can be procured from the Supplier.
The unit of measure that defines Max Supply Amount. Quantity, Volume, and Weight units of measure are supported.
The rate of CO2 emissions for this supplier capability.
The unit of measure (Type = Quantity, Volume, Weight) that defines the CO2 Emission Rate.

SupplierCapabilitiesMultiTimePeriod.Explanation: The period name in which a change is being made. Groups of periods are also supported. Changes that are made in the Multi Time Period table will be applied as overrides for the records of the base table for the specified periods only. Additionally, only the fields that contain information needing to be updated are required to be entered, in the absence of data in the Multi Time Period table the data from the standard table will be persisted
The Supplier at which the listed product will be available at
The Product that will be available at the listed Supplier
Status dictates whether or not the multi-time period record exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the record is ignored during the model run.

Policy Status dictates whether or not the policy exists in the model for the specified period(s). If Policy Status is set to Exclude, the policy record is ignored during the model run for the specified periods.
The unit cost of the listed Supplier creating the Product. This field can support either a single numeric value or a defined step cost
SupplierCapabilitiesMultiTimePeriod.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE StepCosts.StepCostBehavior = [All Item, Incremental, Stepwise]

SupplierCapabilitiesMultiTimePeriod.Explanation: The UOM that specifies what unit the Unit Cost will be applied over. This can be any UOM of Type = Quantity, Weight, Volume.
The maximum amount for the listed product, across all destinations, that can be procured from the Supplier.
The unit of measure that defines Max Supply Amount. Quantity, Volume, and Weight units of measure are supported.
The rate of CO2 emissions for this supplier capability for the given period.
The unit of measure (Type = Quantity, Volume, Weight) that defines the CO2 Emission Rate.

SupplierRiskConfigurations.Explanation: The name of the Risk Profile that the risk configuration is saved for. Risk Profiles are configured to run using specified source data in the Risk Rating Configurations table, and will take the risk weightings and bands associated with the Risk Profile from each of the configuration tables

The weight applied to the Geographic Risk when calculating the Supplier Risk Score. Detailed Geographic Risks configurations on geographic risk components are entered in the Geographic Risk Configurations table.
The weight applied to the User Defined Risk when calculating the Supplier Risk Score.

The weight applied to the Utilization Risk when calculating the Supplier Risk Score. Unlike Facilities, Suppliers will only be impacted by a single capacity factor and therefore there is no need for more detailed Utilization Risk configurations.
The weight applied to the Concentration Risk when calculating the Supplier Risk Score.
The Risk Band that is used to evaluate the Concentration Risk at the Supplier. Risk Bands are defined in the Risk Band Definitions table.

Suppliers.Explanation: Status dictates whether the Supplier exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, any records for the Supplier in other tables will be ignored.
The street address of the Supplier.
The ZIP/postal Code of the Supplier.
The latitude coordinate of the Supplier.
The longitude coordinate of the Supplier.

The maximum amount, across all products, that can be procured from the Supplier during the model solve. For TRIAD models, all inputs expressed here will be treated strictly as Quantity as the MaxSupplyAmountUOM field is not considered for TRIAD runs.
The unit of measure that defines Max Supply Amount. Quantity, Volume, and Weight units of measure are supported.

For any Queues that are evaluated with a Queueing Priority Logic, there can be a By Location component to the priority logic used. If By Location is used, The Queue Priority fields in the Customers, Facilities and Suppliers table will be used to determine how the queues will be ordered

When geocoding a location, or following the most recent DART run, the Geographic Risk will be populated using the Primary Risk Rating defined in Model Settings. For more detailed information on Geographic Risk, reference the Geographic Risk Metrics output table.

An optional input that can be leveraged by DART when calculating Supplier Risk. If left empty for some records, the User Defined Risk will not be considered for those specific Suppliers. The weighting for this component will be defined in the Supplier Risk Configurations table, and any outputs will be reported alongside other geographic risk scores in the Geographic Risk Metrics table.

SuppliersMultiTimePeriod.Explanation: The period name in which a change is being made. Groups of periods are also supported. Changes that are made in the Multi Time Period table will be applied as overrides for the records of the base table for the specified periods only. Additionally, only the fields that contain information needing to be updated are required to be entered, in the absence of data in the Multi Time Period table the data from the standard table will be persisted
Status dictates whether or not the multi-time period record exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the record is ignored during the model run.
Supplier Status dictates whether the Supplier exists in the model for the specified period(s). If Status is set to Exclude, any records for the Supplier in other tables will be ignored.
The maximum amount, across all products, that can be procured from the Supplier during the model solve.
The unit of measure that defines Max Supply Amount. Quantity, Volume, and Weight units of measure are supported.

For any Queues that are evaluated with a Queueing Priority Logic, there can be a By Location component to the priority logic used. If By Location is used, The Queue Priority fields in the Customers, Facilities and Suppliers table will be used to determine how the queues will be ordered

TableFilters.Explanation: The input table that the filter is targeting.

The name assigned to the filter. If this filter is applied against Customers, Facilities, Suppliers, Products, Periods, BOMs, WorkCenters, WorkResources, Modes or Processes then it can be used as an input where entries from the target table would have been supported. This will function the same as a group when used as an input record, however the members captured by the filter logic will be evaluated each time the model is run.
The logic applied against the listed Table Name for the filter.
The map logic applied against the listed Table Name for the filter.
The engine logic applied against the listed Table Name for the filter.

TemplateRoutes.Explanation: The name of the given template route. This Template Route Name will appear in the Transportation Route Summary output table.
The Transportation Asset that is used for the specified template route.

If a Template Route can accept additional shipments, the rule for where those shipments can be placed in the drop sequence is specified as one of the following: Insert Anywhere, Insert Before, or Insert After. The default value will be No Insertion, meaning no additional shipments can be added to the Template Route.
TemplateRoutes.Data Type: [No Insertion, Insert Anywhere, Insert Before, Insert After]

TemplateRoutes.Explanation: Status dictates whether or not the Line Item exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, this record will be ignored during the model run.

TransitMatrix.Explanation: The origin of the transportation arc.
The destination of the transportation arc.

Optionally, a Transportation Asset can be defined for any given Origin / Destination pairing. Different distances and times can be specified for individual Transportation Assets between the same Origin / Destination pairing. If nothing is entered, the Distance / Time will be applied over all Transportation Assets.
The distance of the transportation arc for the given Origin / Destination / Asset combination.
The unit of measure (Type = Distance) that defines Transport Distance.
The travel time of the transportation arc for the given Origin / Destination / Asset combination.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Transport Time.
An additional cost incurred if this segment is used in a route, the cost will be included in the distance cost in outputs.
If True, the same distance and time will be applied for movements between the Origin and Destination in both directions.
Status dictates whether or not the Line Item exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, this record will be ignored during the model run.

TransportationAssets.Explanation: The name of the Transportation Asset. This value can be referenced in other tables involving Transportation Assets.
The units of this Asset that are available at the specified Base Location. If left blank, this is assumed to be an infinite amount of available assets
The Facility at which the Asset is based. Units of this Asset will be located at the Base Location at the beginning of the model run.

The schedule (defined in the Business Hours table) dictating when the Transportation Asset will be available. The vehicle must start and finish its route within one continuous business hours window. If no schedule is specified, the asset can be used all day.
Status dictates whether or not the Asset exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the Asset is ignored in all tables. The Asset will be dropped from policies that reference it.
The name of the Transportation Rate. This value can be referenced in other tables involving Transportation Rates.

The type of the rate defined in the TransportationRates table. For LastDestination and FurthestDestination, Hopper will look up the correct rate using the RouteDestinationName column in the TransportationRates table. LastDestination will use the customer visited last in the route while FurthestDestination will use the furthest customer from the DC in the route.
The one-time fixed cost incurred per unit of the Asset used in the model run.
The capacity (quantity) of the Asset. The most restrictive capacity given in this record (among quantity, volume, and weight) will be applied to the Asset.
The unit of measure (Type = Quantity) that defines Quantity Capacity.
The fill level of the Asset (quantity). Quantity Fill Level is the minimum quantity of items required for the Asset to depart.
The unit of measure (Type = Quantity) that defines Quantity Fill Level.
The capacity (volume) of the Asset. The most restrictive capacity given in this record (among quantity, volume, and weight) will be applied to the Asset.
The unit of measure (Type = Volume) that defines Volume Capacity.
The fill level of the Asset (volume). Volume Fill Level is the minimum volume of items required for the Asset to depart.
The unit of measure (Type = Volume) that defines Volume Fill Level.
The capacity (weight) of the Asset. The most restrictive capacity given in this record (among quantity, volume, and weight) will be applied to the Asset.
The unit of measure (Type = Weight) that defines Weight Capacity.
The fill level of the Asset (weight). Weight Fill Level is the minimum volume of items required for the Asset to depart.
The unit of measure (Type = Weight) that defines Weight Fill Level.
The max distance of each route that this Asset can be assigned to.
The unit of measure (Type = Distance) that defines Max Distance Per Route.
The max time of each route that this Asset can be assigned to.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Max Time Per Route.
The max wait time within each route that this Asset can be assigned to.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Max Wait Time Per Route.
The max number of stops that can be on a route that this Asset is assigned to.
The minimum number of routes required in a tour (asset schedule) over the model horizon.
The maximum number of routes allowed in a tour (asset schedule) over the model horizon.
The maximum length of a tour (asset schedule) over the model horizon. This is calculated as the time between the start of the first route and the end of the last route for the asset.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines the Max Time Per Tour.
The speed that the Asset will travel at.
The unit of measure that defines the Asset Speed.
The fixed time required at the pickup locations for this Asset. This will be additive to the FixedPickupTime specified in the Shipments table.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Fixed Pickup Time.
The fixed time required at the delivery locations for this Asset. This will be additive to the FixedDeliveryTime specified in the Shipments table.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Fixed Delivery Time
The time required per unit to be loaded onto this Asset at the pickup locations. This will be additive to any UnitPickupTime that is specified in the Shipments table.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Unit Pickup Time.
The time required per unit to be delivered at destination locations by this Asset. This will be additive to any UnitDeliveryTime that is specified in the Shipments table.
The unit of measure that defines the basis on which UnitPickupTime and UnitDeliveryTime will be applied for the Shipment. Quantity, Volume, and Weight units of measure are supported.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Unit Delivery Time.
If True the vehicle will always return to its domicile at the end of the route. If False, the route will end at the last delivery location
The maximum drive time that can occur within a shift. A rest period happens between two shifts.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines the max drive time within shift.
The maximum duty time that can occur within a shift. Duty time includes any activity that is not a rest between two shifts. So this field controls the length of each shift
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines the max duty time within shift.
The minimum rest time that needs to occur between two shifts.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines the rest time between shifts.
The maximum cumulative drive time that is allowed within a route since the last short break or rest. A short break needs to happen when this limit is reached.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines the max drive time before short break.
The minimum break time that needs to occur when MaxDriveTimeBeforeShortBreak is reached.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines the short break.
The max out of route distance for each route that this Asset can be assigned to.
The unit of measure (Type = Distance) that defines Max Out of Route Distance.
The max out of route distance Percent for each route that this Asset can be assigned to. This constraint enforces a maximum out of route distance based on a percentage of the total route distance
The weight of the transportation asset when empty. This weight is added to the weight of products being shipped by this asset and will be used for CO2 emission calculations.
The unit of measure of Type = Weight that the asset weight is defined in terms of.
The rate of CO2 emissions for this transportation asset.

The unit of measure (Type = Distance, Quantity-Distance, Volume-Distance, Weight-Distance) that defines the CO2 Emission Rate. If a UOM of Type = Distance is used, the total distance of the route will be used to calculate CO2 emissions. If weight-distance is used, the product of the total route distance and the total delivered shipment weight will be used.
TransportationAssets.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE UnitsOfMeasure.Type = [Distance, Quantity-Distance, Volume-Distance, Weight-Distance]

TransportationAssetsMultiTimePeriod.Explanation: The period name in which a change is being made. Groups of periods are also supported. Changes that are made in the Multi Time Period table will be applied as overrides for the records of the base table for the specified periods only. Additionally, only the fields that contain information needing to be updated are required to be entered, in the absence of data in the Multi Time Period table the data from the standard table will be persisted
The name of the Transportation Asset. This value can be referenced in other tables involving Transportation Assets.
Status dictates whether or not the multi-time period record exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the record is ignored during the model run.
Asset Status dictates whether or not the policy exists in the model for the specified period(s). If Asset Status is set to Exclude, the policy record is ignored during the model run.
The units of this Asset that are available at the specified Base Location.
The Facility at which the Asset is based. Units of this Asset will be located at the Base Location at the beginning of the model run.
The one-time fixed cost incurred per unit of the Asset used in the model run.

The unit cost associated with flow transported using the specified Asset. This field can support a single numeric value, a step cost lookup (defined in the Step Costs table), or a custom cost function. If a cost is entered on a record using this Asset in the Transportation Policies table, that cost will overwrite the one entered here.

The unit of measure that defines Unit Cost. Quantity, Volume, Weight, Distance, Time, Quantity-Distance, Quantity-Time, Volume-Distance, Volume-Time, Weight-Distance, and Weight-Time units of measure are supported.
TransportationAssetsMultiTimePeriod.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE UnitsOfMeasure.Type = [Quantity, Volume, Weight, Time, Distance, Quantity-Distance, Volume-Distance, Weight-Distance, Quantity-Time, Volume-Time, Weight-Time]
TransportationAssetsMultiTimePeriod.AllowableUOMTypes: [Quantity, Volume, Weight, Time, Distance, Quantity-Distance, Volume-Distance, Weight-Distance, Quantity-Time, Volume-Time, Weight-Time]

TransportationAssetsMultiTimePeriod.Explanation: The capacity (quantity) of the Asset. The most restrictive capacity given in this record (among quantity, volume, and weight) will be applied to the Asset.
The unit of measure (Type = Quantity) that defines Quantity Capacity.
The fill level of the Asset (quantity). Quantity Fill Level is the minimum quantity of items required for the Asset to depart.
The unit of measure (Type = Quantity) that defines Quantity Fill Level.
The capacity (volume) of the Asset. The most restrictive capacity given in this record (among quantity, volume, and weight) will be applied to the Asset.
The unit of measure (Type = Volume) that defines Volume Capacity.
The fill level of the Asset (volume). Volume Fill Level is the minimum volume of items required for the Asset to depart.
The unit of measure (Type = Volume) that defines Volume Fill Level.
The capacity (weight) of the Asset. The most restrictive capacity given in this record (among quantity, volume, and weight) will be applied to the Asset.
The unit of measure (Type = Weight) that defines Weight Capacity.
The fill level of the Asset (weight). Weight Fill Level is the minimum volume of items required for the Asset to depart.
The unit of measure (Type = Weight) that defines Weight Fill Level.
The weight of the transportation asset when empty. This weight is added to the weight of products being shipped by this asset and will be used for CO2 emission calculations.
The unit of measure of Type = Weight that the asset weight is defined in terms of.
The rate of CO2 emissions for this transportation asset for the given period.

The unit of measure (Type = Distance, Quantity-Distance, Volume-Distance, Weight-Distance) that defines the CO2 Emission Rate. If a UOM of Type = Distance is used, the total distance of the route will be used to calculate CO2 emissions. If weight-distance is used, the product of the total route distance and the total delivered shipment weight will be used.
TransportationAssetsMultiTimePeriod.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE UnitsOfMeasure.Type = [Distance, Quantity-Distance, Volume-Distance, Weight-Distance]

TransportationBandCosting.Explanation: The name of the Transportation Rate. This value can be referenced in other tables involving Transportation Rates.

The property of the Source (Supplier or Facility) that the Rate cost structure has been created for. For example, a Postal Code to Postal Code rate system could be defined; both the Source and Destination Properties would be set to Postal Code and the Source/Destination values would include all allowable Postal Code pairings.
TransportationBandCosting.Data Type: [Name, Address, City, PostalCode, Region, Country, Organization]

TransportationBandCosting.Explanation: The value to look up in the Source table (either Facilities or Suppliers) Source Property column.

The property of the Destination (Customer or Facility) that the Rate cost structure has been created for. For example, a Postal Code to Postal Code rate system could be defined; both the Source and Destination Properties would be set to Postal Code and the Source/Destination values would include all allowable Postal Code pairings.
TransportationBandCosting.Data Type: [Name, Address, City, PostalCode, Region, Country, Organization]

TransportationBandCosting.Explanation: The value to look up in the Destination table (either Customers or Facilities) Destination Property column.

Distance-dependent piecewise Rates can be modeled using this field; the appropriate Distance Band interval and corresponding Cost will be selected based on the Distance specified in Transportation Policies.
The unit of measure (Type = Distance) used to define Distance Band.

If populated, the shipment size of the transportation policy record where this rate is assigned will be evaluated against the shipment sizes listed in this table for the other matching keys. This will act as a range lookup, similar to how distance bands are evaluated.
The unit of measure that the shipment size is defined in terms of.
The cost that is to be applied when the Rate is referenced in the Transportation Policies table.

The unit of measure that defines Cost. If the Unit Cost UOM field in the Transportation Policies table is populated for records that the listed Transportation Rate is assigned, the value in the Transportation Policies table will be used. If not, the Cost UOM specified in this table will be used along with the cost. UOM Types of Quantity, Volume, Weight, Distance, Time, Quantity-Distance, Quantity-Time, Volume-Distance, Volume-Time, Weight-Distance, and Weight-Time are supported.
TransportationBandCosting.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE UnitsOfMeasure.Type = [Quantity, Volume, Weight, Time, Distance, Quantity-Distance, Volume-Distance, Weight-Distance, Quantity-Time, Volume-Time, Weight-Time]
TransportationBandCosting.AllowableUOMTypes: [Quantity, Volume, Weight, Time, Distance, Quantity-Distance, Volume-Distance, Weight-Distance, Quantity-Time, Volume-Time, Weight-Time]

TransportationBandCosting.Explanation: Status dictates whether or not the Rate exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the Rate will be ignored during the model run.

TransportationDrivers.Explanation: The name of the Driver Class.
The units of this Driver class that are available at the specified Origin Location. If left blank, this is assumed to be an infinite amount of available drivers.
The Facility at which the driver is based.
The Assets that this driver class is allowed to operate. This can be a single Asset or a group of Assets, if a group is entered then all Assets in the group can be operated by the driver class.

TransportationLaneModeQueueDetails.Explanation: The origin Facility or Supplier of the lane that the queue details apply to
The destination Customer or Facility of the lane that the queue details apply to
The Product of the lane that the queue details apply to
The Transportation Mode that the policy record applies to.

The first Date/Time at which to review the queue for the specified Transportation Lane Mode combination. Lane Mode queues will be evaluated using the logic specified in the Priority Logic field. After this Date/Time, the review period length will dictate when transportation lane queue reviews occur. If NULL, Review Period First Time will be the start of the simulation.

The time between lane mode queue reviews. After Review Period First Time, a lane mode queue review will occur each time Review Period has elapsed. For example, if Review Period First Time is 1/1/2022 12:00:00 AM and Review Period is six hours, we will conduct reviews on 1/1/2022 at 12:00:00 AM, 6:00:00 AM, 12:00:00 PM, and 6:00:00 PM, continuing similarly until the simulation ends. A Review Schedule defined in the Review Schedules table can be entered by Review Schedule Name in this field as well. If NULL, continuous review is used.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Review Period length.

The logic used for the Transportation Lane Mode combination when deciding how to arrange orders in the shipment queue. If a value of By Date And Location is selected, the QueuePriority fields in the Customers, Facilities, and Suppliers will be leveraged. If the Advanced Queueing Details table is populated, the override priorities for the Origin, Destination, Product combination will be used
Status dictates whether or not the policy exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the policy record is ignored during the model run.

The cost associated with an item sitting in a queue. The cost expressed in this field will be charged each time that items sit in a queue for the length of time specified in the Time In Queue Cost UOM field.
The unit of measure that time is expressed in terms of.

TransportationLaneQueueDetails.Explanation: The origin Facility or Supplier of the lane that the queue details apply to
The destination Customer or Facility of the lane that the queue details apply to
The Product of the lane that the queue details apply to

The first Date/Time at which to review the queue for the specified Transportation Lane. Lane queues will be evaluated using the logic specified in the Priority Logic field. After this Date/Time, the review period length will dictate when transportation lane queue reviews occur. If NULL, Review Period First Time will be the start of the simulation.

The time between lane queue reviews. After Review Period First Time, a lane queue review will occur each time Review Period has elapsed. For example, if Review Period First Time is 1/1/2022 12:00:00 AM and Review Period is six hours, we will conduct reviews on 1/1/2022 at 12:00:00 AM, 6:00:00 AM, 12:00:00 PM, and 6:00:00 PM, continuing similarly until the simulation ends. A Review Schedule defined in the Review Schedules table can be entered by Review Schedule Name in this field as well. If NULL, continuous review is used.
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Review Period length.

The logic used for the Transportation Lane when deciding how to arrange orders in the order queue. If a value of By Date And Location is selected, the QueuePriority fields in the Customers, Facilities, and Suppliers will be leveraged. If the Advanced Queueing Details table is populated, the override priorities for the Origin, Destination, Product combination will be used
Status dictates whether or not the policy exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the policy record is ignored during the model run.

The cost associated with an item sitting in a queue. The cost expressed in this field will be charged each time that items sit in a queue for the length of time specified in the Time In Queue Cost UOM field.
The unit of measure that time is expressed in terms of.

TransportationModes.Explanation: The name of the Transportation Mode. This value can be referenced in other tables involving Transportation Modes.
The rule that governs the behavior for any flows that use this Mode. This is a SIM-specific field.
The name of the Transportation Asset assigned to this Mode. Capacity, Fill Level, and Cost fields in this table will be overwritten by those of the specified Asset (if one is given).
Status dictates whether or not the Mode exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the Mode is ignored in all tables.

The cost associated with each unit of flow transported using this Mode. This field can support a single numeric value, a step cost lookup (defined in the Step Costs table), transportation rate, or a custom cost function. If a cost is entered on a record using this Mode in the Transportation Policies table, that cost will override the one entered here.
TransportationModes.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE StepCosts.StepCostBehavior = [All Item, Incremental, Stepwise]

TransportationModes.Explanation: The unit of measure that defines Unit Cost. Quantity, Volume, Weight, Distance, Time, Quantity-Distance, Quantity-Time, Volume-Distance, Volume-Time, Weight-Distance, and Weight-Time units of measure are supported.
TransportationModes.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE UnitsOfMeasure.Type = [Quantity, Volume, Weight, Time, Distance, Quantity-Distance, Volume-Distance, Weight-Distance, Quantity-Time, Volume-Time, Weight-Time]
TransportationModes.AllowableUOMTypes: [Quantity, Volume, Weight, Time, Distance, Quantity-Distance, Volume-Distance, Weight-Distance, Quantity-Time, Volume-Time, Weight-Time]

TransportationModes.Explanation: The cost associated with a shipment made under the specified Source/Destination/Product/Mode combination. The Average Shipment Size will be used to estimate the number of shipments that occurred; the Fixed Cost will be applied to the estimated number of shipments according to the Fixed Cost Rule.
TransportationModes.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE StepCosts.StepCostBehavior = [All Item, Incremental, Stepwise]

TransportationModes.Explanation: The rule by which Fixed Cost is applied to the estimated number of shipments. The cost can be prorated in the event that the estimated number of shipments is not an integer. If the selected rule is Treat as Full, the estimated number of shipments will be rounded up and the fixed cost will be applied accordingly.

The average shipment size associated with this Source/Destination/Product/Mode combination. This figure will be used to estimate the fixed cost of shipments and will also be used in combination with any Time or Distance Unit Costs. If NULL, a default value of one unit will be assumed.
The unit of measure that defines Average Shipment Size. Quantity, Volume, and Weight units of measure are supported.
The Fuel surcharge applied to this mode.
The Basis for the fuel surcharge applied to this mode. If percentage is selected, surcharge per unit = UnitCost*(1+ FuelSurcharge). If Per Unit is selected then surcharge per unit = FuelSurcharge
The capacity (quantity) of the Mode. The most restrictive capacity given in this record (among quantity, volume, and weight) will be applied to the Mode.
The unit of measure (Type = Quantity) that defines Quantity Capacity.
The fill level of the Mode (quantity). Quantity Fill Level is the minimum quantity of items required for the Mode to depart.
The unit of measure (Type = Quantity) that defines Quantity Fill Level.
The capacity (volume) of the Mode. The most restrictive capacity given in this record (among quantity, volume, and weight) will be applied to the Mode.
The unit of measure (Type = Volume) that defines Volume Capacity.
The fill level of the Mode (volume). Volume Fill Level is the minimum volume of items required for the Mode to depart.
The unit of measure (Type = Volume) that defines Volume Fill Level.
The capacity (weight) of the Mode. The most restrictive capacity given in this record (among quantity, volume, and weight) will be applied to the Mode.
The unit of measure (Type = Weight) that defines Weight Capacity.
The fill level of the Mode (weight). Weight Fill Level is the minimum volume of items required for the Mode to depart.
The unit of measure (Type = Weight) that defines Weight Fill Level.

The time required to travel from the Source to the Destination for the specific Product/Mode combination. This is meant to be a function that is attached to the mode and should be evaluated at the transportation policy tables
The unit of measure (Type = Time) that defines Transport Time.
The speed of the Mode.
The unit of measure (Type = Speed) that defines Mode Speed.
The rate of CO2 emissions for this transportation mode.

The unit of measure (Type = Distance, Weight-Distance) that defines the CO2 Emission Rate. If a UOM of Type = Distance is used, then the CO2 generated will be based off of the number of shipments - this would be calculated as the (Flow / Shipment Size) * Distance * CO2 Emission Rate.

TransportationModesMultiTimePeriod.Explanation: The period name in which a change is being made. Groups of periods are also supported. Changes that are made in the Multi Time Period table will be applied as overrides for the records of the base table for the specified periods only. Additionally, only the fields that contain information needing to be updated are required to be entered, in the absence of data in the Multi Time Period table the data from the standard table will be persisted
The name of the Transportation Mode. This value can be referenced in other tables involving Transportation Modes.
Status dictates whether or not the multi-time period record exists in the model. If Status is set to Exclude, the record is ignored during the model run.
Mode Status dictates whether or not the policy exists in the model for the specified period(s). If Mode Status is set to Exclude, the policy record is ignored during the model run.
The rule that governs the behavior for any flows that use this Mode. This is a SIM-specific field.
The name of the Transportation Asset assigned to this Mode. Capacity, Fill Level, and Cost fields in this table will be overwritten by those of the specified Asset (if one is given).

The cost associated with each unit of flow transported using this Mode. This field can support a single numeric value, a step cost lookup (defined in the Step Costs table), transportation rate, or a custom cost function. If a cost is entered on a record using this Mode in the Transportation Policies table, that cost will override the one entered here.
TransportationModesMultiTimePeriod.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE StepCosts.StepCostBehavior = [All Item, Incremental, Stepwise]

TransportationModesMultiTimePeriod.Explanation: The unit of measure that defines Unit Cost. Quantity, Volume, Weight, Distance, Time, Quantity-Distance, Quantity-Time, Volume-Distance, Volume-Time, Weight-Distance, and Weight-Time units of measure are supported.
TransportationModesMultiTimePeriod.Validation Type: ExistsInMasterTable WHERE UnitsOfMeasure.Type = [Quantity, Volume, Weight, Time, Distance, Quantity-Distance, Volume-Distance, Weight-Distance, Quantity-Time, Volume-Time, Weight-Time]
TransportationModesMultiTimePeriod.AllowableUOMTypes: [Quantity, Volume, Weight, Time, Distance, Quantity-Distance, Volume-Distance, Weight-Distance, Quantity-Time, Volume-Time, Weight-Time]
